articles.title: Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from Ambassador of New Zealand
articles.content:
Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from Ambassador of New Zealand
						
Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Patrick John Rata, ambassador of New Zealand to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.
					 Kim had a talk with the ambassador after receiving the credentials.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets New Ambassadors of New Zealand, United Arab Emirates
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets New Ambassadors of New Zealand, United Arab Emirates
						
Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister of the DPRK, separately met and had a talk with Patrick John Rata, new ambassador of New Zealand, and Abdulla Khalfan Mater Al Romaithi, ambassador of the United Arab Emirates newly accredited to the DPRK, when they paid courtesy visits to him on Wednesday.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Comoros
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Comoros
						
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Ikililou Dhoinine, president of the Federal Islamic Republic of the Comoros, on Monday.
					 The president in his message extended sincere congratulations to Kim Jong Un on behalf of the government and people of Comoros and on his own behalf on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the DPRK, a fraternal country.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un success in his work of leading the DPRK.
					
					 He expressed the hope that all the work for developing and consolidating the friendly relations between the two fraternal countries would successfully advance.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un good health and the fraternal people of the DPRK progress and prosperity.
					
					 He expressed the highest regards to Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Vishwanath Leaves
articles.content:
Vishwanath Leaves
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Vishwanath, secretary general of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council and director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, left here on Wednesday.

articles.title: Foreign Delegates to 13th Pyongyang International Film Festival Arrive
articles.content:
Foreign Delegates to 13th Pyongyang International Film Festival Arrive
						
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Delegations and delegates from Sweden, UK, China and Hong Kong of China arrived here on Wednesday for the 13th Pyongyang International Film Festival.
					 Earlier, international judges from Germany, Russia, Australia and China and delegations and delegates from Russia, Democratic Congo, Switzerland and France arrived.

articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to Sweden Appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Sweden Appointed
						
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Pak Kwang Chol was appointed as DPRK ambassador to the Kingdom of Sweden by a decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: Pyongyang, Korea-Yanbian, China Friendship Library Opens
articles.content:
Pyongyang, Korea-Yanbian, China Friendship Library Opens 
						
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang, Korea-Yanbian, China Friendship Library opened with due ceremony in Yanbian Korean Nationality Autonomous Prefecture on Sept. 6 to mark the 64th anniversary of the DPRK. 
					 Present at the opening ceremony were officials of the government, media organizations and other officials concerned and masses in the autonomous prefecture, the delegation of the Publications Exchange Association of Korea and other Korean officials working in China. 
					
					 At the ceremony the director of the Department of Culture of the autonomous prefecture and the head of the DPRK delegation made speeches. They were followed by the signing of an agreement on the co-management of the library. 
					
					 A Korean book and photo exhibition opened at the library on the same day.

articles.title: National Korean Dress Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
National Korean Dress Exhibition Opens
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The 10th national Korean dress exhibition was opened in Pyongyang.
					 Present there were technicians and skilled workers of factories and enterprises in different parts specializing in processing clothes and tailor shops as well as teachers, researchers, creators and experts in education and research institutions and members of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea.
					
					 Displayed in the venue of the exhibition were more than 1 300 garments including casual dresses, holiday dresses, wedding dresses, children's clothes and other Korean dresses, suits, coats and skirts.
					
					 The exhibition will involve a workshop on the design and processing of Korean dresses and seasonal dresses and services of technological books on garment and multi-media show.
					
					 Its opening ceremony took place at the Central Youth Hall on Wednesday.
					
					 It will last till Friday.

articles.title: Inventions Exhibition Held in New Way
articles.content:
Inventions Exhibition Held in New Way
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The 12th National Exhibition of Inventions and Technologies took place here in a fresh way from Aug. 27 to Sept. 3.
					 Kim Yong Gon, a section chief of the DPRK State Science and Technology Commission, told KCNA:
					
					 "The recent exhibition served as a place for making dealings between inventors and manufacturers. Its main purpose was to help invigorate the economy and improve people's livelihood.
					
					 We summed up nationwide demands for each technology and distributed the guideline of the exhibition to inventors from two months before the exhibition's opening.
					
					 About 1 000 applications for order of new inventions were accepted until the end of the exhibition.
					
					 The exhibition witnessed a lot of contracts on making and purchasing inventions and technologies as well as technological service. It also gave a multi-media lecture on the theme of "Regulations on intellectual properties dealing" and other lectures on latest science and technology.
					
					 Visitors could get access to data about foreign and local patents at the exhibition.
					
					 The exhibition showcased the development of the nation's science and technology."

articles.title: Koryo Sungkyunkwan Academy Has New Building
articles.content:
Koryo Sungkyunkwan Academy Has New Building
						
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- A new building of the Koryo Sungkyunkwan Academy was constructed at the foot of Mt. Songak in Kaesong City.
					 The building is located beside the main building and has three blocks. It has modern comprehensive lecture room, classrooms, experimental rooms, chair rooms, welfare facilities, etc. that are necessary for teaching, scientific research and study.
					
					 An opening ceremony was held on Wednesday.
					
					 Present there were DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim, Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission, Pak Thae Dok, chief secretary of the North Hwanghae Provincial Committee of the WPK, and Kang Yong Su, chairman of the Provincial People's Committee.
					
					 Kim Yong Il, chief secretary of the Kaesong City Committee of the WPK, said in his opening speech that President Kim Il Sung visited Kaesong City on May. 5, 1992, named the academy, clarified its founding year, defined faculties and subjects and clarified in detail the issues arising in the construction and management.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il indicated the direction and ways for building the new modern building despite pressure of work, he said.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un provided wise leadership for the construction of the new building, he said.
					
					 He called upon all the teachers and students to steadily improve the educational content and ways and establish the study morale so as to become able teachers and talents who can contribute to the development of light industry and improvement of the people's standard of living.

articles.title: KPISF Song and Dance Ensemble Performs in Hamhung
articles.content:
KPISF Song and Dance Ensemble Performs in Hamhung 
						
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The Song and Dance Ensemble of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces (KPISF) gave performance and conducted agitation activities for increased production in Hamhung from Sept. 14 to 19.
					 Among the audience were officials of party and power organs, working people's organizations and industrial establishments, servicepersons and people in South Hamgyong Province.
					
					 The performance, which the dear respected Kim Jong Un watched and highly praised, was given before full houses, striking a chord with the audience.
					
					 Its repertoire included orchestral music and chorus "The Sound of a Horse's Hooves in Mt. Paektu", male solo and chorus "Fly High, Our Party Flag", male duet and chorus "General Uses the Art of Shrinking the Earth" and dance "Ongheya".
					
					 The performance brought the profound respect for President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un to the hearts of the audience while assuring them of a rosy future of Songun Korea led by Kim Jong Un.  
					
					 Other numbers showed the warm love and noble traits of Kim Jong Un who takes care of the people's destiny and future, and the loyalty of all servicepersons and people to him.
					
					 The performance included folk music and light music which applauded the determination of the servicepersons of the KPISF to reliably stand in the van in defending the leader, social system and people.
					
					 The artistes of the ensemble staged agitation for increased production at the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex, February 8 Vinalon Complex and Ryongsong Machine Complex that are conducting campaigns to increase production upholding the flame kindled in Hamnam.

articles.title: Chol Pass, Witness to Kim Jong Il's Devoted Songun Leadership
articles.content:
Chol Pass, Witness to Kim Jong Il's Devoted Songun Leadership
						
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- A monument to the proposition "Chol Pass Is Symbol of Songun Revolutionary Leadership. Kim Jong Il" was recently erected at the entrance to Chol Pass in Kangwon Province, the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The Chol Pass stretches 32 kilometers with thrilling cliffs and steep bends.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il in his lifetime made ceaseless inspection tours of the frontline army units, going through the pass regardless of bad weather conditions, for the sake of the security of the country, a legacy bequeathed by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Once, he personally drove the car on the pass to inspect an army unit.
					
					 His inspection tours of units through the pass were prompted by his belief that to give priority to military affairs is the only way for defending the dignity of the nation. They represented his ardent patriotism and courage as an illustrious commander.
					
					 The Chol Pass is a witness to the history of Kim Jong Il's energetic Songun revolutionary activities, and it is kept in the minds of the DPRK people as a guardian of the country and socialism along with his august name.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Ouster of Lee Myung Bak Regime
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Ouster of Lee Myung Bak Regime
						
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The Korean nation can not achieve independent reunification, peace and prosperity unless the Lee Myung Bak conservative forces are ousted, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a bylined article.
					 Calling for the ouster of the Lee puppet regime in south Korea, the article brings to light the fact that it has laid a serious obstacle in the way of the country's reunification by pursuing the anachronistic policy of dependence on outside forces.
					
					 The Lee regime has regarded "the north's abandonment of nuclear program" touted by the U.S. as the core of its "policy toward the north" and made desperate efforts to realize it, the article says, adding:
					
					 The regime is following the U.S. which set the nuclear and "human rights" rackets as the political means for stifling the DPRK.
					
					 Recently the regime held a ceremony of proclaiming the "month of human rights of the north" and kicked off sordid burlesques in different areas of south Korea as part of its stepped-up campaign to dare hurt the dignified image of the DPRK.
					
					 It has been intent on the military provocation and war moves, posing serious threats to the peace and security on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 It staged the "exercise for operating the extended nuclear deterrence" together with the U.S. in which the DPRK was singled out as the target of preemptive nuclear attack. This has increased the danger of a nuclear war on the peninsula.
					
					 Only a handful of traitors to the nation have quenched the pure desire of the compatriots for the independent reunification, peace and prosperity, bedeviled the north-south relations and increased the danger of a nuclear war. This is really a matter of great regret.
					
					 All the Koreans in the north, the south and abroad are called upon to turn out as one in the nation-wide actions to wipe out the Lee group of traitors who are going desperate to escalate the confrontation against the country's reunification, while selling off the dignity and interests of the nation to outside forces.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Frustrating U.S.-Japan-S. Korea Military Alliance
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Frustrating U.S.-Japan-S. Korea Military Alliance
						
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is contemplating knocking into shape the triangular military alliance in collusion with Japan and south Korea. This should never be tolerated as it is an anachronistic and reactionary military bloc.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The Asia-Pacific region has become a major front for the imperialists' madcap reactionary and military offensive at present.  
					
					 The U.S. has attached great importance to the U.S.-Japan military alliance and the U.S.-Japan-south Korea military nexus in realizing its military strategy, the Northeast Asia strategy, in particular.
					
					 It cries out for "detente" and "disarmament" in other regions. 
					
					 However, it has escalated the tension in Northeast Asia while persistently bolstering its line for military confrontation and stepping up its preparations for a war there.
					
					 The triangular military alliance is of aggressive and offensive nature. This is clearly evidenced by the fact that it regards the Korean Peninsula, area of primary importance in implementing the pressing goal of the U.S. war strategy, as its first target of attack.
					
					 The U.S. works hard to ignite a war in the peninsula to put into practice its reactionary strategy toward Asia and Korea.
					
					 The enemies' wild ambition through the formation of the tripartite military nexus and their criminal moves for realizing it pose a grave threat to independence, peace and security of Asian countries.
					
					 Only when Asians and other world peace-loving people turn out in actions against the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces' moves to invade the DPRK and the Japanese reactionaries' moves to stage a comeback to Korea, can the triangular military alliance for aggression be checked and foiled.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will positively fight to hold in check the formation of the above-said alliance and build independent, peaceful and new Asia and world in close unity with Asians and all other world peace-loving people.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Regime's Military Maneuvers Slammed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Regime's Military Maneuvers Slammed
						
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet forces conducted amphibious maneuvers, another show of Inchon landing operation of the U.S. troops in the past Korean War, in waters off Wolmi Island from Sept. 13 to 15 with more than 1 500 troops, various warships and KAAVs involved. They even invited lots of people to watch it.
					 They are now set to "commemorate" the battles in the River Rakdong and Chunchon area.
					
					 It is another grave politically-motivated military provocation against the DPRK for the Lee regime to move to "commemorate" the war of aggression on the DPRK.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined commentary.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that the Lee Myung Bak group has gone so shameless as to recall the departed souls in different places of south Korea while calling for "commemorating" the battles in the Korean War, the commentary points out, and goes on:
					
					 Serious is that it is not just a mere distortion of the history of the war of aggression. This is aimed to provoke the second Korean War by imbuing the south Korean society with the feelings of bitter hostility and confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 It is ridiculous, indeed, for the Lee group to dream of invading the DPRK while crying out for "commemoration", instead of drawing a lesson from the shameful defeat in the last Korean War.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will never miss the chance to annihilate the warmongers and achieve the final victory for the national reunification by giving the fullest play to the tremendous military might they have built up, should the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces dare provoke.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Moves to Grab Tok Islets Censured by Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries' Moves to Grab Tok Islets Censured by Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The Japanese Foreign Ministry held a press conference recently at the instructions of the Japanese prime minister at which it cried out for the settlement of the Tok Islets issue at the International Court of Justice, claiming that the islets belong to Japan. It decided to make information video titled "Tok Islets are part of Japan's inviolable territory" and circulate it around the world. Japan has run ads laying claim to Tok Islets in about 70 central and local newspapers.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 This proves that their moves to grab the islets have reached a very reckless phase.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' assertion that the islets "belong to Japan" amounts to a vicious insult and encroachment upon the dignity and sovereignty of the Korean nation.
					
					 It is their real intention to make the islets an international dispute by misleading public opinion and thus justify their moves for grabbing the islets and realize their sordid aim to stage a comeback to Korea.
					
					 It is the invariable attempt of Japan to achieve the ambition for the "Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere" which it failed to do in the past. When they occupy the Korean Peninsula, they can reinvade Asia with it as a springboard. This is their dirty calculation.  
					
					 Proceeding from this, they have persistently made nonsensical sophism that the islets are "part of the inviolable territory of Japan" in a bid to invent a pretext for the reinvasion of Korea.
					
					 The disgusting act of the Japanese militarists to grab other's islets in a brigandish way can not work on anyone.
					
					 Japan had better behave itself with its own senses.

articles.title: Japan Should Breaks Off Bad Habit of Slandering Others: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Japan Should Breaks Off Bad Habit of Slandering Others: Minju Joson
						
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the Japanese government announced that Japan would stage a military exercise simulating "contingency" from 2013 under the sponsorship of the prime minister's office. It claimed the drill is aimed to cope with the DPRK's "ballistic missile".
					 Portraying the DPRK's satellite launch for peaceful purposes as the "launch of ballistic missile", Japan asserted the need to hold the government-sponsored military drill to cope with the possible launch of another missile by the DPRK.
					
					 This is prompted by the Japanese reactionaries' sinister scenario to create the atmosphere of danger and fear by misinterpreting the DPRK's development of outer space for peaceful purposes as the "launch of ballistic missile", justify their moves to turn Japan into a military giant and realize their wild ambition for reinvasion at any cost under the pretext of coping with the "missile threat".
					
					 Minju Joson Wednesday says this in a bylined commentary.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are persistently branding the DPRK's satellite launch recognized by the world as the "launch of ballistic missile", turning black into white. Their attitude is so groundless and black-hearted, says the commentary, and goes on:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are seeking to realize their old dream of the "Greater east Asia co-prosperity sphere" by realizing their wild ambition to stage a comeback to Korea, backed by the U.S. which tries hard to stifle the DPRK.
					
					 As a Korean proverb says that he who digs a pit for others falls into it, only shameful destruction awaits the Japanese reactionaries running amuck, steeped in the wild ambition for reinvasion.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries should draw a serious lesson from their bitter defeat in the past and immediately give up their foolish thought to realize their purpose for aggression by slandering others.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Slams Lee Myung Bak Group's Act of Brain-washing Soldiers
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Slams Lee Myung Bak Group's Act of Brain-washing Soldiers
						
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak puppet regime of south Korea is conducting an extreme education for brain-washing soldiers into having the consciousness of confrontation with fellow countrymen. 
					 The south Korean military recently presented more than 120 "questions for the recognition and evaluation of entities following the north" and let officers and men of the army sit for the compulsory "examination concerning the forces following the north". 
					
					 The ever-more undisguised mental education within the military in recent years is attributable to the heinous plots for confrontation with fellow countrymen by the Lee Myung Bak regime to use the army as a bullet shield at a time of invading the north and a tool for fascist suppression of pro-reunification progressive forces.
					
					 The military bosses including Kim Kwan Jin, minister of Defense, called it an essential and natural mental education of the army. This reflects the policy-oriented nature of the education.
					
					 From the outset of its taking office, the regime has prioritized the "education concerning forces following the north" while asserting that raised consciousness of security is more important than the modernization of the army.
					
					 Calling for setting right the "left-leaning soldiers' outlook on enemy", it set up again the school for mental education in defense, which was operational during the past dictatorial regime, in the Defense University. It also expanded and reorganized the action-oriented scientific research institute into the all-out mental and action-oriented scientific research institute. It is creating "security park" in each place the army is stationed, and brain-washing soldiers into having the consciousness of hostility toward the north.
					
					 The former and incumbent chiefs of general staff of the ground force are blaring that the north constitutes "a direct and serious threat" and "principal enemy". The DPRK is also defined as the "principal enemy" in the "white paper on national defense". 
					
					 The Lee group is zealously conducting mental education to instill "the steadfast outlook on enemy" into cadets and soldiers of all military academies and units.
					
					 In the last two years the Lee group increased the budget for "security lectures" ten times and made sure that almost all the lectures were consistent with the content of inciting antagonism against fellow countrymen.
					
					 Such "lectures concerning forces following the north" were given 152 times in units above division between January and June and nearly 8 600 times in units of battalion level in the 2011-2012 period.
					
					 Before receiving training and going on watch-out duty at the units, officers and soldiers have to recite written oath and pledge containing a phrase that "our enemy is the army of the north." It has become the duty of officers to instill the "outlook on enemy" into soldiers.
					
					 Circulated among the foremost line units were videos which described the Jejudo Popular Uprising, case of the People's Revolutionary Party, 2008 candlelight resistance, etc., as ones by the "agitation of the pro-north forces." Set up in all places where the army serves are slogan boards and posters which define the DPRK as the "enemy." Firing targets in training grounds and areas simulating north's territories under occupation have marks symbolizing the north.
					
					 There have been intentional provocations such as writing or hanging slogans and large suspension posters slandering the social system and army of the DPRK at a great number of barracks, posts, military facilities of the frontline units, guide boards on surrounding roads and walls.
					
					 The south Korean military, steeped in the idea of the confrontation with the DPRK, is committing heinous provocations one after another while conducting indiscriminate firing drills targeting the DPRK's flags and even images representing the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK. This grave situation goes to fully prove how reckless the mental education of the puppet regime has reached. But the Lee regime is seriously mistaken.
					
					 No move for mental education can ever conceal justice and truth and save the group from the crisis.
					
					 The Korean nation will certainly deal most merciless punishment to the Lee group which is going all the more reckless before its ruin.

articles.title: Typhoon 16 Causes Damage in S. Korea
articles.content:
Typhoon 16 Causes Damage in S. Korea 
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Typhoon 16 hit south Korea, claiming damage, according to KBS and MBC of south Korea on Monday.
					 50mm per hour heavy rain pounded Jeju City, Jeju Island.
					
					 Houses were inundated and over 70 cases of damage happened on the island.
					
					 Meanwhile, landslides in Songju and Kyongju in North Kyongsang Province left 4 dead and several injured.
					
					 Hundreds of houses were inundated or broken down and the electricity service to 520 000 houses was cut off.
					
					 Classes were suspended in nearly half of all the primary, middle and high schools across south Korea and traffic put in trouble in more than 100 spots.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Should Opt for National Peace and Co-Existence: Korean in U.S.
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Should Opt for National Peace and Co-Existence: Korean in U.S.
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Suk, a Korean in the U.S., published the article titled "There is a limit to our patience" on Sept. 13 denouncing the U.S. and the south Korean warmongers for their reckless anti-DPRK war exercises. 
					 The article said:
					
					 The U.S. asserted in the DPRK-U.S. joint statement on June 11, 1993 and the joint statement on September 19, 2005 that it has no intent to attack or invade the DPRK with nuclear and conventional weapons.
					
					 According to it, at the meetings on Feb. 13 and October 3, 2007, the United States committed itself several times to improve the bilateral relations with the DPRK and opt to have complete diplomatic relations as action steps to implement the September 19 joint statement.
					
					 Nevertheless, the U.S. has failed to implement any of them but designated the north as part of the "axis of evil" and the target of preemptive nuclear attack, fanning up the Lee Myung Bak "government's" policy of escalating confrontation with the north and putting a brake on the process for improving the relations with the north.
					
					 In particular, the U.S. staged war drills for preemptive attack in this year's Key Resolve, Foal Eagle and Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises to realize the strategy for invading the north.
					
					 Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un in a speech at the celebration banquet on August 25, 2012 said that there is a limit to the Korean people's patience and made iron-willed declaration that they will not remain a passive onlooker to the enemies' desperate moves for aggression but will do everything they can to defend the destiny of the country and the nation. 
					
					 U.S. imperialism and the Lee "government" and the "Saenuri Party" which are subordinate to it would be well advised to make a correct judgment at the crossroad of war or peace.
					
					 The article urged the south Korean authorities to sincerely implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and opt for the road of national peace and con-existence, not for a war and destruction.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Lauded by Korean Resident in U.S.
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Lauded by Korean Resident in U.S. 
						
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Ri Jun Mu, a Korean resident in the U.S., posted on his Internet homepage on August 31 an article titled "Wooden boat of love sailing to Jangjae Islet defying waves" at a time when the news that Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un inspected island defence detachments in the biggest hotspot in the southernmost area in the southwestern sector of the front made a big splash in the world.
					 The article said:
					
					 The world was shocked by a documentary film showing Marshal Kim Jong Un, a new leader of the north, inspecting Jangjae and Mu islets in the biggest hotspot in the southwestern sector of the front aboard a wooden boat. Media vied with each other to make special reports. World's attention focused on him.
					
					 The hot wind of Kim Jong Un is sweeping not only among the people in the north but in the south and overseas Koreans' community.
					
					 A small wooden boat was sailing in the West Sea where clouds of a war were hanging low. Who would have thought of Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the DPRK, taking such a simple wooden boat!
					
					 He was accompanied by only some people. It gave delightful and pleasant feelings to watch him talking with them. His appearance amounted to the affectionate look of a parent going to meet his sons and daughters living in far away places.
					
					 In fact, many people do not know where such small islets as Jangjae and Mu islets are in the West Sea. 
					
					 But Kim Jong Un went to the island defence detachments in the biggest hotspot in the world where KPA soldiers are always standing in acute confrontation with hostile forces. War maneuvers for aggression are being staged in the nearby area of the south side almost every day. He went to soldiers who are standing guard over this foremost post.
					
					 His appearance was, indeed, one of their real father and the great leader.
					
					 But it was not always smiles that he had on his face. When he stepped on the islet and watched the enemy's trench in the opposite side, his eyes were alight with fire.
					
					 "If even a single shell is fired to our territory, promptly deal deadly strike and lead it to a great war for national reunification!"
					
					 Kim Jong Un issued a stern order while inspecting the island defence detachments that day.
					
					 Hearing this news on TV, all the service personnel and people of the north shouted hurrah at the top of their voices, looking up to him.  
					
					 They were full of the conviction that they would certainly reunify the country under his leadership.
					
					 The moment, his congratulatory speech which I heard at Kim Il Sung Square on the morning of the Day of the Sun this year came across my head. He said, "I will become a comrade-in-arm sharing the destiny always with comrades on the sacred road of the Songun revolution and discharge my obligation for the country and the revolution true to the behests of Comrade Kim Jong Il."
					
					 The people across the country who were hearing his speech at that time and all other Koreans in the south and abroad who heard this news were overwhelmed by inexpressible excitement.
					
					 Jangjae Islet! Mu Islet! They are islets whose names they have never heard before but they were greatly excited.
					
					 These islets not well known among the people are now called islets where Kim Jong Un's love for the people has been brought to bloom like a legend and mysterious islets which would mercilessly shatter the provocation of aggressors.
					
					 His image on the documentary film was affectionate and generous. One could feel that he has magnanimity big enough to embrace all the Koreans. It was the appearance of the great leader who would embrace 70 million fellow countrymen in the north and the south and abroad.
					
					 He held a child in his arms. This was a scene of human sincerity which is more valuable than millions of tons of gold.
					
					 His appearance was so simple and ordinary. One could not find any coercion and a bit of repugnance in his look. His virtues and greatness attracting all could be felt.
					
					 Overflowing in his shining eyes were the love for his country and soldiers, burning hatred for the enemy and brave spirit. His appearance that day was enough for the Koreans to give vent to their deep reverence and trust in their supreme commander. The leader and the people have become as one like this. This was a scene which so vividly showed the course of the single-minded unity in the DPRK lauded by the world.
					
					 The Korean nation accepted sycophancy and national ruin like their destiny, unable to defend itself as it has had no correct leadership even though it was proud of the history and brilliant culture spanning five thousands of years. This was the appearance of the Korean nation as a miserable and weak colonial nation one century ago. But the DPRK has now become a full-fledged political and military power and working people there are demonstrating their dignity as the independent people whom no one dare provoke.
					
					 The people in the north find the factor of this in being blessed by the illustrious leaders and generals. The people in the south admit this. This is the pride of not only the north but the whole nation. With this pride of the DPRK, waves off Jangjae Islet are splashing and waves off Mu Islet are dancing joyfully.
					
					 Jangjae and Mu islets of reunified Korea are visible. Happy sounds of laughter of the families ringing out from these peaceful and beautiful islets, the earthly paradise full of joy, under the leadership of Kim Jong Un will resound through the world by waves.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Published in Italy
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Published in Italy
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's work "Let Us Uphold Independence" was published in a pamphlet by the Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism Study Group in Fermo of Italy on September 9.
					 The work published on September 7, 1981 clarifies the idea that it is a requirement of the present era to adhere to independence in activities of the party and state and that the Juche idea is a philosophy centered on human.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced by Belarusian Political Party, Russian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced by Belarusian Political Party, Russian Organization
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The full text of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Only Victory and Glory Are in Store for Us Advancing under the Uplifted Immortal Banners Bearing Portraits of Smiling Great Comrades Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il" was posted by the Communist Workers' Party of Belarus on September 8 and the Moscow Workers' Union of Russia on August 29 on their Internet websites.
					 This speech Kim Jong Un made at the celebration banquet on August 25, 2012 clarifies the Songun leadership feats performed by Generalissimo Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It calls for making great efforts for a final victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche and Songun pioneered by Generalissimo Kim Il Sung and successfully led by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il's Works Studied and Disseminated in Ethiopia, Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il's Works Studied and Disseminated in Ethiopia, Democratic Congo
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- A reading session and a seminar for the study of works of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il were held in Ethiopia and Democratic Congo between September 3 and 8.
					 An official of the water project design and supervisory enterprise in Ethiopia said he deeply grasped the revolutionary career and greatness of the President through the reading session of Vol. 1 of Part I the Anti-Japanese Revolution of "With the Century," reminiscences of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 It was thanks to the great leaders that the once distressed Korean people are enjoying to their satisfaction the rights as masters of the country and that the DPRK is exercising with pride its sovereignty in the international arena, he noted, adding:
					
					 The DPRK founded by Kim Il Sung and developed by Kim Jong Il will further prosper thanks to the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The chairman of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of University of Kinshasa, Democratic Congo explained the main content of Kim Jong Il's work "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea Is a Socialist State of Juche with Invincible Might". 
					
					 He said:
					
					 The work comprehensively deals with the sacred history and invincible might of the DPRK founded and developed by the President.
					
					 The situation of the DPRK proves that a country and a nation can become a great country and nation only when they are under the leadership of the great leader and party.
					
					 Today the DPRK is further developing under the leadership of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 As he is leading revolution in its van, the Korean people will emerge victorious in their drive for building a thriving nation and achieving national reunification.

articles.title: DPRK's Anniversary Marked by Foreign Media
articles.content:
DPRK's Anniversary Marked by Foreign Media
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Various foreign papers dedicated special write-ups to the 64th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The Bangladeshi paper Natun Bangla on Sept. 5 carried an article titled "DPRK, politico-ideological power and military power" under the bannerline of "On the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the DPRK" with smiling portraits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Saying the foundation of the DPRK marked a historical event in paving the way for building an original socialist state centered on popular masses in Korea, the paper said that the DPRK is demonstrating its might as a politico-ideological power and a military power.
					
					 The Guinean paper Horoya on Sept. 4 carried an article titled "Songun politics and Korean-style socialism" with a photo of Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un standing on the tribune of honor at the military parade in celebration of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un, identical to the President and Kim Jong Il in ideology, leadership and personality, is now embodying without an inch of deflection the idea and line of the preceding leaders, the article noted.
					
					 The Korean people will invariably keep to the path of independence, Songun and socialism.
					
					 The Mongolian paper Zuuny Medee on Sept. 7 in an article titled "People's Korea marks its anniversary" said the DPRK has demonstrated its dignity as an independent power under the leadership of the great Generalissimos.
					
					 The Indian paper Indian and World Event on Sept. 4 carried articles titled "An independent power" and "Boundless reverence".

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Celebrated in Russia, Finland, Ecuador
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Celebrated in Russia, Finland, Ecuador 
						
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Meetings took place in Russia, Finland and Ecuador from Sept. 4 to 7 to celebrate the 64th anniversary of the DPRK. 
					 On display at the venues of the meetings were works of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and other Korean books and photos showing the glorious history of the DPRK. 
					
					 Dmitri Kostenko, chairman of the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, said Korea, which was a colony of the Japanese imperialists in the past, is now demonstrating its might as an invincible power. This set a typical example of building an independent state for the world people, he said, adding:
					
					 The achievements of the DPRK are a fruition of the Juche idea and Songun politics. The most important factor was that the Korean people were fortunate to have been led by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Antti Sika Aho, chairman of the Finland-Korea Society, said the foundation of the DPRK and its development would be unthinkable without the great exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Their revolutionary cause is being successfully carried forward by the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, he stressed. 
					
					 Juha Kieksy, chairman of the Finnish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, hoped that the Korean people would achieve bigger successes in building an economic power and implementing the cause of national reunification holding high the banner of the Juche idea true to the leadership of Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Trotsky Serano, president of the Canar Provincial Institute for the Friendship and Solidarity with the DPRK of Ecuador, extended full support and solidarity to the Korean people advancing for the final victory under the Songun leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 A message of greeting to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting in Finland.

articles.title: Withdrawal of U.S. Troops from S. Korea Demanded
articles.content:
Withdrawal of U.S. Troops from S. Korea Demanded 
						
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Personages of Bangladesh and Nigeria made public statements on Sept. 10 and 11 on the lapse of 67 years since the U.S. troops illegally occupied south Korea. 
					 M. Gamrul Huda, chairman of the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea, said that the period since the U.S. military occupation of south Korea has been interwoven with crimes by which they disturbed peace of the Korean Peninsula and gravely threatened the security of the Korean nation. 
					
					 The U.S. military presence in south Korea is the root cause of the outbreak of a new war on the peninsula, he said, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. remains unchanged in its ambition for implementing its policy for aggression of the whole of Korea while keeping its forces in south Korea. 
					
					 It is anachronistic for the U.S. to keep its forces in south Korea still today after the lapse of a long time since the end of the Cold War. 
					
					 The U.S. troops should be withdrawn from south Korea as early as possible in order to head off the danger of war and ensure peace and security on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 Aba Sadik Abubakr, chairman of the Nigerian Group for the Study of the Juche Philosophy, said:
					
					 The Korean nation could not but suffer the tragedy of separation owing to the U.S. occupation of south Korea. It's is to achieve the independence of the whole of Korea and its independent development. 
					
					 The U.S. has intensified the hostile policy toward the DPRK with the goal of overthrowing the socialist system chosen by the Korean people. 
					
					 The present situation urges to put an end to the U.S. military presence in south Korea at an early date.

articles.title: Bangladesh Political Figure Praises DPRK
articles.content:
Bangladesh Political Figure Praises DPRK 
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League and chairman of the Bangladesh Self-Reliance Research Centre, made public a statement on Aug. 30 to mark the 64th anniversary of the DPRK. 
					 In the statement he said President Kim Il Sung founded the DPRK, a genuine independent and sovereign state where the popular masses have become the master of the country, and developed it into a socialist power -- independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in national defence. 
					
					 Thanks to leader Kim Jong Il the Korean people could greet the new heyday of building a thriving socialist nation despite the imperialists' provocations and hardships, he said, and went on:
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un will firmly carry forward the sacred revolutionary history and tradition started on Mt. Paektu and achieve bigger successes in building a thriving nation, holding aloft the banner of the great Juche idea, Songun idea.

articles.title: 67th UN General Assembly Opens
articles.content:
67th UN General Assembly Opens
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The 67th session of the UN General Assembly was opened at the UN Headquarters on Sept. 18.
					 Present there were delegations and delegates from more than 190 countries and regions including the DPRK.
					
					 Former Serbian Foreign Minister Vuk Jeremic was elected president of the session.
					
					 The session will discuss wide-ranging problems including peace, security, disarmament and human rights.
					
					 The 66th session of the UN General Assembly was closed on Sept. 17.

articles.title: Chinese Youth and Students Condemn Japan's Moves to Expand Territory
articles.content:
Chinese Youth and Students Condemn Japan's Moves to Expand Territory
						
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The AllChina Youth Federation and the All-China Students' Federation recently released a joint statement condemning the Japanese authorities' moves for expanding territory.
					 The statement said Japan's allegation that Diaoyu Islands are part of its "inviolable territory" stemmed from its oblivion of the historical fact and is a blatant challenge to the success of the world anti-fascist war and the post-war international order.
					
					 The Chinese youth and students will never tolerate this and any form of provocation, it said, adding they will firmly safeguard all the steps and all kinds of acts of justice by the government for defending the state sovereignty, and always stand by the party, government and people.

articles.title: China Opposes Act of Insulting Islam
articles.content:
China Opposes Act of Insulting Islam
 Beijing, September 18 (KCNA) -- Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Hong Lei in a press conference on Sept. 15 clarified the stand of his country opposing the acts of insulting Islam.
					 Recalling protest actions that swept various countries following the U.S. movie insulting Islam, he said that China is opposed to any act of insulting Islam and hurting the feelings of Islamism.
					
					 He noted that his country is consistent in its stand for mutual respect and equality, not insulting and hurting the dignity of religion.

articles.title: U.S. Anti-Islam Film Enrages World People
articles.content:
U.S. Anti-Islam Film Enrages World People
						
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- A movie recently produced by a Jewish businessman in the United States has shaken the world as it insulted Islam and Islam's Prophet Muhammad.
					 He openly posted the movie titled "Innocence of Muslims" on an Internet website on Sept. 11, stirring a firestorm of protests among Islamists.
					
					 In a message issued on Sept. 13, Supreme Leader of the Islamic Republic Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said that "behind this evil move lie the antagonistic policies of the Zionists and the U.S. and other heads of the global arrogance".
					
					 "If the U.S. politicians are honest in their claim of not being involved (in the production of this film), (they) must bring the perpetrators of this hideous crime and their financial backers, who have wrenched the hearts of Muslim nations, to face a punishment proportionate to this great crime," Khamenei was quoted as saying.
					
					  Tehran's Senior Cleric Ahmad Jannati said the movie was produced under financial support of Israel, calling it an unprecedented insult to Muslim.
					
					 Iraqi Prime Minister Nuri al-Maliki said in a statement issued by his office that the repeated insult to the religious sanctities by suspicious individuals and groups deserve the severest condemnation, particularly, the recent film which is devoid of any value but the abuse of Muslim sanctities and noble values. 
					
					 The statement said that the natural response to such acts should be by cooperation between the followers of all (monotheistic) religions to prevent circulation of such suspicious ideas and refrain from resorting to violence and to show the principles of Islam and its values of civilization.
					
					 "The freedom of expression should not be an excuse to practice abuses against the religious sanctities," it added.
					
					 The Foreign Ministry of Pakistan in a statement said the movie seriously hurt the people of Pakistan and all other Islamists, calling for refraining from insulting religions.
					
					 Iranian Foreign Ministry spokesman Ramin Mehmanparast said the Islamic Republic stresses that the systematic and continuous silence of the U.S. administration in case of such disgusting moves that are made in line with anti-Islam campaign is the main factor for the continuation of such moves.
					
					 The Foreign Ministry of Algeria said in a statement on Sept. 12 that the abuses of religious sacred symbols, whatever they are, can not but arouse indignation and condemnation because such provocations intend to stir up hatred and tension, and thus thwart efforts being made on the international level as part of the dialogue among civilizations and religions.
					
					 Popular protests against the U.S. insult to Muslim occurred all over the world.
					
					 The U.S. administration should take full responsibility for the consequence entailed by the film and punish those involved in it as well as sincerely reflect and apologize for it.

articles.title: Russia Rebuffs Resolution of European Parliament
articles.content:
Russia Rebuffs Resolution of European Parliament 
						
 Moscow, September 18 (KCNA) -- The press official of the Russian president rebuffed a resolution of the European Parliament on the human rights condition of his country.
					 There was a discussion in Russia on depriving a deputy to the State Duma from opposition party of his rights. The European Parliament adopted the resolution terming it an attempt to curb the legitimate political activities of a representative of the opposition party. The official branded this as groundless.
					
					 It is not known what information source and analysis the European Parliament had used in the course of adopting the resolution, he noted, adding that Russia would never accept the ungrounded resolution.

articles.title: Iran Produces New Drone
articles.content:
Iran Produces New Drone
 Tehran, September 18 (KCNA) -- Iran continues directing big efforts to increasing its national defence capabilities.
					 As part of its efforts, the country recently produced an indigenous unmanned aerial vehicle capable of loading missile.
					
					 In this regard, the Iranian commander of the Islamic Revolution Guards Corps said on Sept. 16 that the drone named "Shahed 129" is capable of flying for 24 hours and attacking long-distance targets with missile, to say nothing of reconnaissance missions.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de Fatrick John Rata
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de Patrick John Rata
						
Pyongyang, 19 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Patrick John Rata presento el dia 19 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae ante Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, sus cartas credenciales que le acreditan como el embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de Nueva Zelanda en Corea.
					Tras recibirlas, Kim departio con el diplomatico.

articles.title: Canciller coreano se reune con nuevos embajadores extranjeros
articles.content:
Canciller coreano se reune con nuevos embajadores extranjeros
						
Pyongyang, 19 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El canciller de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea Pak Ui Chun, departio este miercoles por separado con el nuevo embajador de Emiratos Arabes Unidos, Abdulla Khalfan Mater Al Romaithi y el otro de Nueva Zelanda, Fatrick John Rata, quienes le hicieron la visita de cortesia.

articles.title: Inaugurada Biblioteca de Amistad Pyongyang-Yanbian
articles.content:
Inaugurada Biblioteca de Amistad Pyongyang-Yanbian
						
Pyongyang, 19 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 64o aniversario de la fundacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, quedo inaugurada el dia 6 en la region autonoma de coreanos de Yanbian la Biblioteca de Amistad Pyongyang de Corea-Yanbian de China. 
					En la ceremonia de apertura participaron los funcionarios del gobierno de la region autonoma de coreanos de Yanbian, los de prensa e informacion y otros concernientes y las masas, la delegacion de la Asociacion de Intercambio de Publicaciones de Corea y los funcionarios coreanos que trabajan en China. 
					
					Pronunciaron el director de Cultura de la region autonoma y el jefe de la delegacion de la Asociacion arriba mencionada. 
					
					Acto seguido, hubo la ceremonia de la firma del acuerdo sobre la gestion conjunta de la biblioteca. 
					
					El mismo dia, quedo inaugurada la exhibicion de libros y fotos de Corea en la misma biblioteca.

articles.title: Inaugurada exposicion nacional de trajes
articles.content:
Inaugurada exposicion nacional de trajes
						
Pyongyang, 19 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurada el dia 19 en la Casa Central de la Juventud en esta capital la X exposicion nacional de trajes coreanos.
					En el certamen tomaron parte los tecnicos y obreros calificados de las fabricas, empresas y sastrerias, los maestros, investigadores, creadores y especialistas de los organos docentes y de investigacion y las mujeres de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea.
					
					En la ocasion fueron presentados mas de un mil 300 trajes coreanos, entre otros, las ropas ordinarias, las de fiesta, las de boda y las de ninos y los trajes de hombres y mujeres.
					
					Durante la exposicion se realizaran la creacion de diseno de trajes coreanos y ropas estacionales, el cursillo sobre la confeccion de ropas y el servicio de libros de tecnologia y multimedias por el respecto.
					
					La exposicion terminara el dia 21.
